Your app manages online gift cards for a soon-to-be-major e-tailer. Customers can use the app to place orders using their card balance. We have classes that model the GiftCard and the Customer. Your task is to write a test suite for them. Below is the implementation of `GiftCard` ```ruby class GiftCard attr_reader :balance, :error def initialize(balance) if balance < 0 raise ArgumentError.new("New gift card cannot have negative balance") end @balance = balance @error = nil end def withdraw(amount) if @balance >= amount @balance -= amount else @error = "Insufficient balance" return nil end end end ``` In this question, construct tests that verify: * a GiftCard when first created has a non-negative cash balance * a GiftCard when first created assigns itself a balance --- describe GiftCard do it 'fails to instantiate with negative balance' do expect !BLANK(-1)!BLANK.!BLANK raise_error(ArgumentError) end it 'successfully assigns a positive balance on instantiation' do gift_card = GiftCard.new(20) !BLANK(gift_card.balance).to !BLANK(20) end end
